page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: Wimpey is a national building firm working near our school.They are converting 128 orginal houses into 105 and renovating them.Each house is costing about Â£17,000. The total bill for the houses is Â£1,700,000. They started the work in January 1985 and hope to finish in May 1986. These houses are all army quarters and were orginally built in 1932.There are about 80 workers of different trades on the site and we saw many of them at their work when we were shown round the site.The other national building firm is Barratts.They are building private houses as an extension to their existing estate in Scotton Village, where the first houses were built about ten years ago.
